Posts.Content: My dreams up until this weeks surgery ran the gamut from my marriage in the beginning over fourty years ago to burning up in a car crash. Now with my Blood pressure back to normal I figure variations on recurrence may become the norm for the next few. Hope the best for you.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Second biopsy clear, infection sets in requiring infusion antibiotic treatment. Robotic surgery 11/24/15. Post surgery recovery normal. Severe side effect to Cialis. Have not Resumed ED treatment. Total ED for time being. Incontenance still an issue due to chronic bronchitis/ cough. PSA ZERO 4 months post surgery.

Posts.Title: Odd Dreams

Posts.Content: I started Cialis before my RP and 25 days later developed dueling smoke alarms in my ears. Stopped immediately and within a week the screaming settled down. Bought generic viagra from urologist but I'm hesitant to try it. I can live with total ED but not my hearing or sight. Will wait a while before venturing into this treatment.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Total ED for time being. Incontenance still an issue due to chronic bronchitis/ cough. PSA ZERO 4 months post surgery.
Posts.Title: Cialis. Who likes it?

Posts.Content: Take it easy on yourself. DO NOT base your recovery on what others achieve. I had my surgery over last thanksgiving and still wear one depends a day . Had severe reaction to ED med and stopped taking them for now. ED total for time being. I am back to my competitive shooting sports and function fine out and about. I'm giving my self at LEAST a year to see whether everything reaches a normal level. I'm just glad I got it out and I'm at Zero PSA now. Enjoy life, everyday is a gift.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Posts.Title: Getting tough to deal with

Posts.Content: Im 5'7" 195. my gp and wife say I need to lose 30 lbs. I have a big belly. I agree, but my urologist / surgeon said nothing except that excess body fat can extend the surgey time. My surgery took just over 5 hours with additional hernia repair. My central robotic access point at just above my belly button has developed a hernia 7 months post op and I have to lose weight for its repair. Ill be better off long term at a lower weight but i got through my RP ok.
Posts.Title: Size matters? With robotic prostatectomy.

Posts.Content: Im 5'7" 195. my gp and wife say I need to lose 30 lbs. I have a big belly. I agree, but my urologist / surgeon said nothing except that excess body fat can extend the surgey time. My surgery took just over 5 hours with additional hernia repair. My central robotic access point at just above my belly button has developed a hernia 7 months post op and I have to lose weight for its repair. Ill be better off long term at a lower weight but i got through my RP ok.
Posts.Title: Size matters? With robotic prostatectomy.

Posts.Content: Thank you all. There will be many questions in the future, first is did any of you change your diet/lifestyle in response to your diagnosis? I don't smoke or drink much. I'm 25 lbs overweight and not an athlete. Stress or other illness will initiate my prostitis flares ups. This one I'm in now has gone on since July 2014. I have asked for years if removing the organ is an option to relieve the constant burning I have. Was always advised against that as a first option. Opinions please. Is there general agreement on bringing an oncologist in at this point in my journey or is that premature?
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, many questions

Posts.Content: Hello fellow travelers. I am 63 years old and have had many bouts of chronic prostitis since my late 20s. PSA tested was always between 2.5 and 4 depending on severity. Treated with antibiotics things would calm down and life would go on. That was until last year. Mother developed lung cancer and I Was deeply involved with getting her and my dads Life set for what was coming for them. Terrible stress level for me caused a Prostitis flare up that continues to today. I knew something was up with a 4.2 PSA that climbed to a 5.9 in 3 months. I don't know all the terms or acronyms yet but I had a 14 sample biopsy a week ago And they found in 10 % of one sample cancer on the Gleason scale 3+3= 6 I go back in 10 days to discuss this health issue. I don't know where to begin, what to ask or anything. There is a lot to learn in a short time, I'm hoping you folks can help me understand what I have coming. No one in my family has ever succumbed to cancer that I know of. My wife's grandfather, only uncle and mother all die from bone Cancer, so she's very concerned. I'm not surprised that my prostate finally gave up The fight but I need help understanding where I am and where I need to go. Thanks all.
Posts.Title: Just diagnosed, many questions

Posts.Title: ED Meds and side effects

Posts.Content: Doc gave me a 30 day, 5 mg, sample of Cialis to aid healing and to help with ED. Have developed significant ringing in my ears and office said to stop Meds.Has anyone else had side effects that have caused them to stop ED treatment? Are there any other treatments that any of you have had success with. My penis is unresponsive, was expecting this but I am hoping for some recovery over time. It is what it is I guess. Thanks all.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Posts.Title: ED Meds and side effects

Posts.Content: Off drug 3 days, tinnitus quieting down. See doc in a few weeks will talk to him then. Went into this knowing ED could be highest hurdle. Working on leakage now, its what I'm focusing on at this point.

Posts.Title: ED Meds and side effects

Posts.Content: A question. I had one of the serious side effects of ED drug therapy. They then suggested and I bought a 15 day supply of sildenafil to give it a try. My question, is there any chance that life will return to my mid section naturally or is chemical Intervention the only option. The hearing problem came on suddenly in the 4th week on Cialis and I'm not sure I want to revisit that or chance developing vision problems. Is everyone on a ED med post surgery? Thanks

Second biopsy clear, infection sets in requiring infusion antibiotic treatment. Robotic surgery 11/24/15. Post surgery recovery normal. Severe side effect to Cialis. Have not Resumed ED treatment. Total ED for time being. Incontenance still an issue due to chronic bronchitis/ cough. PSA ZERO 4 months post surgery.
Posts.Title: ED Meds and side effects

Posts.Content: I joined the group with a low grade PC diagnosis. Following the personal stories here l decided early on to get it out. I didn't need second opinions or exotic testing. It's out, my 35 year battle with prostititis is over and the Gleason 3+3 was contained in the prostrate. My incontinance and ED issues were expected and will hopefully turn around.

Posts.Title: ED Meds and side effects

Posts.Content: Doc gave me a 30 day, 5 mg, sample of Cialis to aid healing and to help with ED. Have developed significant ringing in my ears and office said to stop Meds.Has anyone else had side effects that have caused them to stop ED treatment? Are there any other treatments that any of you have had success with. My penis is unresponsive, was expecting this but I am hoping for some recovery over time. It is what it is I guess. Thanks all.

Posts.Title: infection after markers in

Posts.Content: I came home on Thanksgiving just past to a farm house with 2 flights of stairs. I spent the 10 days I had the catheter installed living in my recliner. I could climb stairs but tired easily. My wife was off until the Monday after TG so it was nice having her there but I could have managed ok alone if necessary. The day before surgery was a bit unsettling because of the unknown. Surgical prepping left me with low blood sugar which added a bit to my anxiety. My wife worked until the day of surgery. The whole experience went better than I had worried about. Wish you all my best.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Posts.Content: I've been reading of increased risk of melanoma with Viagra use. May be something to ask Drs. about. I was given Cialis to start 5 days before surgery. Did that but did not want to continue after because of stomach issues and major bleeding. Will start tomorrow after catheter removed, see what happens.

Posts.Title: How soon after surgery should I be starting viagra or cialis

Posts.Content: Beginning life sans prostate. Catheter removed, after 10 days, 4 days ago still leaking blood unrelated to urination. Office says not unusual. No pain that needs medication. Was concerned Cialis would increase bleeding but office says not an issue. Incontenance issues not unnerving but would not do a lot of drinking away from home. Looking forward to the passage of time. Anyone care to offer their post op experiences? Thanks all.

Posts.Title: Surgical team and coverage.

Posts.Content: If this is too off topic mods please delete. My Davinci surgical team was comprised of my Doctor, who preformed the procedure, an associate surgeon and their support team plus the anesthesiologist. Do all of you remember if you had two surgeons present? My BLUE CROSS insurance is not covering the second Doc. Working through it now. Would appreciate any information offered. They declined all his charges and I am being billed 2500.00 on code S2900. Which is robotic assisted procedures.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Posts.Title: Surgical team and coverage.

Posts.Content: The S2900 is a robotics code that insurances company's don't pay separately. My pre authorization letter stated all the procedures done including robotics but under the code for RP. I wrote a letter to the office after a phone discussion with billing dept that was not very helpful. I asked for all my records and an explanation why the S2900 was not part of the original request. 5 days later they called and said they were writing off the $2500.00 charge. The second doctor was one of the other partners in the group practice. I can only speculate that he was trying to get paid more for his participation. BxBs will pay for the surgery, but will not pay extra for the robot.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Posts.Title: Happy New Year!

Posts.Content: My first 24 hrs post catheter was scary. Drenched most of time. Now, 3+ weeks out from surgery its not too discouraging. Went on a minor road trip for several hours with several stops and I was ok until my cough started up. That's when I have trouble. I don't worry day to day, much improved since catheter removed 10 days ago but I do get frustrated at times still. Take it easy on yourself and it will get better with time.

Posts.Content: Looks good, especially only weeks out. I'm 3 weeks post op and Doc wants PSA at 3 months. Most Docs have their own protocol tuned to your specifics. If mine had ordered one sooner I wouldn't have worried. More tests, more info. Did you ask him why?

Posts.Title: Post Op PSA result

Posts.Content: Yea, I went 5.9 to 1.8 on Avodart. Cured nothing. Need a great deal more info on this stage 4 breast cancer treatment. How much company stock do you own? Sorry, I hate hit and runs.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core. Posts.Title: PSA levels went lower with trial drug

Posts.Content: I'm 63, had a biopsy in February, 14 samples, 1 10% 3+3. Second biopsy May, 16 samples all clear. It is a roller coaster ride for sure. I'm leaning toward surgery, why not take it early in the disease instead of waiting until It becomes more aggressive. I know a number of folks that have done seeds and have had negative results. Equal number of friend with surgery are happier with their results. So you read, ask and listen, choose a direction and don't look back. Until my diagnosis I did not realize how many men around me are dealing with the disease. I wish you all the best with your decision.
Posts.Signature: Born 1951 Chronic prostititus for over 35 years. PSA 4.0 - 5.9 in 18 months. Diagnosed 2/2015 Gleason 3+3 one core.
